intro: Gallitrichum pratense, commonly known as the meadow gallwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces distinctive seed capsules that contain tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Gallitrichum pratense is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments.
